qas.question: Who appointed the governors in the Umayyad empire?
Where was the government of the Umayyads based?
Along with army leaders, police and civil administration, what did the governor control in his province?
What was not divided into several pieces?
What did the borders of the empire do before the Umayyad reign?

plausible_answers.text: neglected to send the extra tax revenue

qas.question: What did governors do with the extra tax revenue in the early years of the dynasty?

plausible_answers.text: the later years of the dynasty

qas.question: When did the central power of the Umayyad rulers increase?

context: Geographically, the <b3_0>empire<b3_0/> was divided into several provinces, the borders of which <b4_0>changed numerous times<b4_0/> during the Umayyad reign. Each province had a <b5_0>governor<b5_0/> appointed by the <a0_0>khalifah<a0_0/>. The governor was in charge of the <a2_0>religious officials<a2_0/>, army leaders, police, and civil administrators in his province. Local expenses were paid for by taxes coming from that province, with the remainder each year being sent to the central government in <a1_0>Damascus<a1_0/>. As the central power of the Umayyad rulers waned in <b7_0>the later years of the dynasty<b7_0/>, some governors <b6_0>neglected to send the extra tax revenue<b6_0/> to Damascus and created great personal fortunes.
